field.label: Description
field.value: The Tanenbaum Open Science Institute (TOSI) prize identifies and support initiatives emerging from within the Neuro community that facilitate open sharing of scientific outputs with key stakeholders, including other researchers, patients, policymakers, and the public.

bilingual.french: Le prix Tanenbaum Open Science Institute (TOSI) identifie et soutient les initiatives émergeant de la communauté du Neuro qui facilitent le partage ouvert des résultats scientifiques avec les principales parties prenantes, notamment d'autres chercheurs, patients, décideurs politiques et le public.
bilingual.english: The Tanenbaum Open Science Institute (TOSI) prize identifies and support initiatives emerging from within the Neuro community that facilitate open sharing of scientific outputs with key stakeholders, including other researchers, patients, policymakers, and the public.

field.label: Description
field.value: Every year the magazine "Québec Science" organizes a contest to recognize the best 10 discoveries of the year. In 2022 I was amongst the laureates. More details at: https://www.quebecscience.qc.ca/categorie/sciences/les-10-decouvertes-de-2022/

bilingual.french: Chaque année, le magazine « Québec Science » organise un concours pour récompenser les 10 meilleures découvertes de l'année. En 2022, je faisais partie des lauréats. Plus de détails sur : https://www.quebecscience.qc.ca/categorie/sciences/les-10-decouvertes-de-2022/

field.label: Recognition Name
field.value: Canada Research Chair in Quantitative Magnetic Resonance Imaging (Tier-2)

linkedWith.label: Organization
linkedWith.value: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC)

field.label: Description
field.value: As Canada Research Chair in Quantitative Magnetic Resonance Imaging, Dr. Julien Cohen-Adad aims to develop innovative, critical hardware and software so that this technological marvel can become a standard tool for radiologists. He and his research team hope that by making seven-tesla MRI systems easier to use, their research will enable earlier disease detection and diagnosis, improving patients’ health outcomes.

bilingual.french: En tant que titulaire de la Chaire de recherche du Canada en imagerie par résonance magnétique quantitative, Julien Cohen-Adad entend mettre au point du matériel et des logiciels novateurs et essentiels, afin que cette merveille technologique devienne un outil standard pour les radiologistes. M. Cohen-Adad et son équipe de recherche espèrent qu’en facilitant l’utilisation des systèmes d’IRM à sept teslas, leurs travaux permettront de détecter et de diagnostiquer plus rapidement les maladies, améliorant ainsi l’état de santé des patients.
bilingual.english: As Canada Research Chair in Quantitative Magnetic Resonance Imaging, Dr. Julien Cohen-Adad aims to develop innovative, critical hardware and software so that this technological marvel can become a standard tool for radiologists. He and his research team hope that by making seven-tesla MRI systems easier to use, their research will enable earlier disease detection and diagnosis, improving patients’ health outcomes.

field.label: Research Interests
field.value: I'm developing new methods for Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to seek sensitive and specific biomarkers of degenerative pathologies in the central nervous system. Techniques include Functional, Diffusion-Weighted MRI and Magnetization Transfer. My developments focus on the hardware (coil) and software (image processing, statistics) levels, as well on the validation in human and animal models.

bilingual.english: I'm developing new methods for Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to seek sensitive and specific biomarkers of degenerative pathologies in the central nervous system. Techniques include Functional, Diffusion-Weighted MRI and Magnetization Transfer. My developments focus on the hardware (coil) and software (image processing, statistics) levels, as well on the validation in human and animal models.

Funding Title
field.value: Physics-informed deep learning architecture to generalize medical imaging tasks

field.label: Project Description
field.value: The main objective of this project is to push the generalization capabilities of medical imaging tasks by incorporating prior information from MR physics and from the inter-rater variability into DL architectures​. The MRI acquisition parameters are part of the generational process of the output image, therefore incorporating this information on the network architecture can act as a gating mechanism for the network to select filters according to these parameters. An intuitive analogy is the colorization of natural images using context-informed DL architectures (e.g., “this image has a building, a tree and a mountain”).

bilingual.english: The main objective of this project is to push the generalization capabilities of medical imaging tasks by incorporating prior information from MR physics and from the inter-rater variability into DL architectures​. The MRI acquisition parameters are part of the generational process of the output image, therefore incorporating this information on the network architecture can act as a gating mechanism for the network to select filters according to these parameters. An intuitive analogy is the colorization of natural images using context-informed DL architectures (e.g., “this image has a building, a tree and a mountain”).

field.value: Optimised Hardware-Architecture Synthesis for Deep Learning

field.label: Project Description
field.value: Deep learning requires considerable computing power. Computing power can be improved significantly by designing application specific computing engines dedicated to deep learning. The proposed project consists of designing and implementing a High Level Synthesis tool that will generate an RTL design from the code of an algorithm. This tool will optimize the architecture, the number of computing units, the length and representation of the numbers and the important parameters of thevarious memories generated.

bilingual.english: Deep learning requires considerable computing power. Computing power can be improved significantly by designing application specific computing engines dedicated to deep learning. The proposed project consists of designing and implementing a High Level Synthesis tool that will generate an RTL design from the code of an algorithm. This tool will optimize the architecture, the number of computing units, the length and representation of the numbers and the important parameters of thevarious memories generated.

field.label: Activity Description
field.value: My team and I have initiated and developed the "Spinal Cord Toolbox", which is a comprehensive and open-source library of analysis tools for multi-parametric MRI of the spinal cord. The toolbox includes a template and several atlases (white and gray matter, spinal tracts, spinal and vertebral levels, etc.), along with state-of-the-art methods to register any data to the template. It also includes useful functions for data preprocessing: extraction of centerline, automatic segmentation, slice-wise motion correction, etc. The toolbox is actively maintained and is well documented. More information here: sourceforge.net/projects/spinalcordtoolbox/

bilingual.french: Mon équipe et moi avons initié et développé la « Spinal Cord Toolbox », qui est une bibliothèque complète et open source d'outils d'analyse pour l'IRM multiparamétrique de la moelle épinière. La boîte à outils comprend un modèle et plusieurs atlas (matière blanche et grise, voies vertébrales, niveaux rachidiens et vertébraux, etc.), ainsi que des méthodes de pointe pour enregistrer des données dans le modèle. Il comprend également des fonctions utiles pour le prétraitement des données : extraction de la ligne médiane, segmentation automatique, correction de mouvement par tranche, etc. La boîte à outils est activement entretenue et bien documentée. Plus d'informations ici : sourceforge.net/projects/spinalcordtoolbox/
bilingual.english: My team and I have initiated and developed the "Spinal Cord Toolbox", which is a comprehensive and open-source library of analysis tools for multi-parametric MRI of the spinal cord. The toolbox includes a template and several atlases (white and gray matter, spinal tracts, spinal and vertebral levels, etc.), along with state-of-the-art methods to register any data to the template. It also includes useful functions for data preprocessing: extraction of centerline, automatic segmentation, slice-wise motion correction, etc. The toolbox is actively maintained and is well documented. More information here: sourceforge.net/projects/spinalcordtoolbox/

field.label: Activity Description
field.value: I have led several spinal cord imaging projects involving patients with spinal cord injury (Paris, Montreal, Toronto, Boston). For each project I have implemented an imaging protocol specific to the MRI manufacturer (my expertise covers Siemens, GE and Philips) and I have written guideline manuals for internal use (~50 pages). These manuals are directed towards MR technicians and describe guidelines for optimal imaging, including patient positioning, coaching, imaging slice prescription (including screenshots), use of sequence and parameters, debugging procedure in case of image artifacts, etc.

bilingual.french: J'ai dirigé plusieurs projets d'imagerie de la moelle épinière impliquant des patients atteints de lésions médullaires (Paris, Montréal, Toronto, Boston). Pour chaque projet, j'ai mis en place un protocole d'imagerie spécifique au fabricant d'IRM (mon expertise couvre Siemens, GE et Philips) et j'ai rédigé des manuels d'orientation à usage interne (~ 50 pages). Ces manuels s'adressent aux techniciens IRM et décrivent les lignes directrices pour une imagerie optimale, y compris le positionnement du patient, le coaching, la prescription de tranches d'imagerie (y compris les captures d'écran), l'utilisation de séquences et de paramètres, la procédure de débogage en cas d'artefacts d'image, etc.
bilingual.english: I have led several spinal cord imaging projects involving patients with spinal cord injury (Paris, Montreal, Toronto, Boston). For each project I have implemented an imaging protocol specific to the MRI manufacturer (my expertise covers Siemens, GE and Philips) and I have written guideline manuals for internal use (~50 pages). These manuals are directed towards MR technicians and describe guidelines for optimal imaging, including patient positioning, coaching, imaging slice prescription (including screenshots), use of sequence and parameters, debugging procedure in case of image artifacts, etc.

field.label: Activity Description
field.value: I inform and suggest optimal MRI acquisition and processing protocols for researchers, especially for advanced techniques such as functional MRI, diffusion MRI and magnetization transfer. I offer consultation service in forms of advice, manuals and/or training of local research assistants and radiologic technicians. I am currently a consultant for: Drs. Rossignol (Montreal), Doyon (Montreal), Rainville (Montreal), Roy (Montreal), Mainero (Boston), Klawiter (Boston), Fehlings (Toronto), Pradat (Paris) and others. Also, as the associate director and MR physicist of the Neuroimaging Functional Unit of the Institut Universitaire de Gériatrie de Montréal, I regularly inform and suggest optimal MRI acquisition protocols to local researchers. End users are mostly neuroscientists, neuropsychologists and image processing experts.

bilingual.french: J'informe et propose des protocoles optimaux d'acquisition et de traitement d'IRM aux chercheurs, notamment pour les techniques avancées telles que l'IRM fonctionnelle, l'IRM de diffusion et le transfert d'aimantation. J'offre un service de consultation sous forme de conseils, de manuels et/ou de formation d'assistants de recherche locaux et de techniciens en radiologie. Je suis actuellement consultant pour : Drs. Rossignol (Montréal), Doyon (Montréal), Rainville (Montréal), Roy (Montréal), Mainero (Boston), Klawiter (Boston), Fehlings (Toronto), Pradat (Paris) et autres. Aussi, à titre de directeur associé et physicien IRM de l'unité fonctionnelle de neuroimagerie de l'Institut Universitaire de Gériatrie de Montréal, j'informe et suggère régulièrement des protocoles optimaux d'acquisition d'IRM aux chercheurs locaux. Les utilisateurs finaux sont pour la plupart des neuroscientifiques, des neuropsychologues et des experts en traitement d'images.

Also, as the associate director and MR physicist of the Neuroimaging Functional Unit of the Institut Universitaire de Gériatrie de Montréal, I regularly inform and suggest optimal MRI acquisition protocols to local researchers. End users are mostly neuroscientists, neuropsychologists and image processing experts.

field.label: Activity Description
field.value: I have initiated the first open-access multi-parametric spinal cord MRI database (n=265 subjects), by setting up a standardized MRI acquisition protocol and by assembling a team from 42 renowned research centers. Cohen-Adad et al. Spinal Cord MRI Public Database (Multi-subjects). 10.18112/openneuro.ds001919.v1.0.4. https://openneuro.org/datasets/ds001919

bilingual.french: J'ai initié la première base de données IRM multiparamétriques de la moelle épinière en libre accès (n=265 sujets), en mettant en place un protocole d'acquisition IRM standardisé et en réunissant une équipe de 42 centres de recherche renommés. Cohen-Adad et al. Base de données publique IRM de la moelle épinière (multi-sujets). 10.18112/openneuro.ds001919.v1.0.4. https://openneuro.org/datasets/ds001919

bilingual.english: Publications/Awards

field.label: Description / Contribution Value/Impact
field.value: Dr. Cohen-Adad has established himself as one of the world leader in spinal cord imaging. He published 135+ articles (7430 citations, h-index=77, Source: Google Scholar 2021-08-16) and 160+ conference abstracts, edited the first book on quantitative MRI of the spinal cord (Elsevier) and have organized 8+ workshops at international conferences. As a recognition for these achievements, he has been awarded the competitive Chercheur Boursier fellowship from FRQS (ranked 1st over 25 applications in Quebec) and in 2015 he received the highly-competitive Foundation grant from the Canadian Institute of Health Research (11% success rate).

bilingual.english: Dr. Cohen-Adad has established himself as one of the world leader in spinal cord imaging. He published 135+ articles (7430 citations, h-index=77, Source: Google Scholar 2021-08-16) and 160+ conference abstracts, edited the first book on quantitative MRI of the spinal cord (Elsevier) and have organized 8+ workshops at international conferences. As a recognition for these achievements, he has been awarded the competitive Chercheur Boursier fellowship from FRQS (ranked 1st over 25 applications in Quebec) and in 2015 he received the highly-competitive Foundation grant from the Canadian Institute of Health Research (11% success rate).

field.label: Title
field.value: Novel hardware for spinal cord MRI

bilingual.english: Novel hardware for spinal cord MRI

field.label: Description / Contribution Value/Impact
field.value: Dr. Cohen-Adad has designed and built the first 32-channel coil for imaging the cervical spinal cord at 3T (cover page of MRM journal) and the first 19-channel coil at 7T (cover page of MRM). These coils have been used for pioneer applications to study pain, spinal cord injury and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. In partnership with Resonance Research Inc. (USA) and thanks to his CFI leader grant, he has developed the first 24-channel shim coil to address the issues of field inhomogeneities in spinal cord MRI [Topfer16]. Results have shown unprecedented improvements in image quality compared to those provided by current state-of-the-art clinical scanners.

bilingual.english: Dr. Cohen-Adad has designed and built the first 32-channel coil for imaging the cervical spinal cord at 3T (cover page of MRM journal) and the first 19-channel coil at 7T (cover page of MRM). These coils have been used for pioneer applications to study pain, spinal cord injury and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. In partnership with Resonance Research Inc. (USA) and thanks to his CFI leader grant, he has developed the first 24-channel shim coil to address the issues of field inhomogeneities in spinal cord MRI [Topfer16]. Results have shown unprecedented improvements in image quality compared to those provided by current state-of-the-art clinical scanners.

field.label: Title
field.value: Image analysis software for spinal cord MRI

bilingual.english: Image analysis software for spinal cord MRI

field.label: Description / Contribution Value/Impact
field.value: Dr. Cohen-Adad has pioneered the first comprehensive and open-source image processing software dedicated to spinal cord multi-parametric MRI: the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) (https://sourceforge.net/projects/spinalcordtoolbox/). While popular brain software cannot address some specific requirements for processing spinal cord data, SCT includes spinal cord templates and atlases, automatic methods for segmentation the spinal cord and its gray matter, and robust methods to extract relevant MRI biomarkers sensitive to degeneration and demyelination in the white matter. SCT includes methods published in 15+ journals, the software has been downloaded over 2500+ times and has been cited in 50+ studies. SCT is rapidly becoming the standard software amongst the community worldwide.

bilingual.english: Dr. Cohen-Adad has pioneered the first comprehensive and open-source image processing software dedicated to spinal cord multi-parametric MRI: the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) (https://sourceforge.net/projects/spinalcordtoolbox/). While popular brain software cannot address some specific requirements for processing spinal cord data, SCT includes spinal cord templates and atlases, automatic methods for segmentation the spinal cord and its gray matter, and robust methods to extract relevant MRI biomarkers sensitive to degeneration and demyelination in the white matter. SCT includes methods published in 15+ journals, the software has been downloaded over 2500+ times and has been cited in 50+ studies. SCT is rapidly becoming the standard software amongst the community worldwide.
